sections.heading: by referee; procedure; findings of fact; conclusions of law; effect
sections.text: The trial before referees is conducted in the same manner as a trial by the court. They have the same power to summon and enforce the attendance of witnesses, to administer all necessary oaths in the trial of the case, and to grant

sections.heading: to arbitrators. In re Arbitration of Johnson, 87 Neb. 375, 127 N.W. 133 (1910).
sections.text: to arbitrators. In re Arbitration of Johnson, 87 Neb. 375, 127 N.W. 133 (1910).
